questions.question: ………………….. we worked day and night we could not finish the project on time.
questions.description: Although is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: Samuel ……………………………. was my classmate at school now works in Germany.
questions.description: Use who to refer to people that cannot be used in non-identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: ………………… running fast, I could not catch up with him.
questions.description: Either despite or in spite of can be used here.

questions.question: I ran as fast as I could ………………………., I could not beat him.
questions.description: However does not connect two sentences. It is a transitional adverb. Use a full stop or a semicolon before however.

questions.question: 7……………………… his leg injury, he played well.
questions.description: In spite of is a preposition. It is followed by a noun or ing form.

questions.question: ………………… you do something about that letter from the taxmen, you will be in trouble.
questions.description: Unless means if not. This sentence means the same as 'If you do not do something about that letter from the taxmen, you will be in trouble.'

questions.question: I asked her why ………………………….. crying.
questions.description: In indirect questions, the subject goes before the verb.

questions.question: The dishwasher ……………………………. I bought for my mother is expensive.
questions.description: Either that or which can refer to objects in identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: The weather ……………………………… stormy, we cancelled the picnic.
……………………. you are my best friend, I don’t want any secrets between us.
questions.description: As gives the reason it is similar to because and since.
